UITestFramework

Class CreateSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • UITestFramework.CreateSession
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoginTest

    public class CreateSession
extends java.lang.Object
    contains all the methods to create a new session and destroy the session after the test(s) execution is over. Each test extends this class.

    • Method Detail

      • invokeAppium

        public void invokeAppium()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        this method starts Appium server. Calls startAppiumServer method to start the session depending upon your OS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Unable to start appium server

      • stopAppium

        public void stopAppium()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        this method stops Appium server.Calls stopAppiumServer method to stop session depending upon your OS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Unable to stop appium server

      • createDriver

        public void createDriver(java.lang.String invokeDriver,
                         java.lang.reflect.Method methodName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        this method creates the driver depending upon the passed parameter (android or iOS) and loads the properties files (config and test data properties files).
        Parameters:
        invokeDriver - android or iOS
        methodName - - name of the method under execution
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - issue while loading properties files or creation of driver.

      • teardown

        public void teardown()
        this method quit the driver after the execution of test(s)

      • startAppiumServer

        public void startAppiumServer(java.lang.String os)
                       throws org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException,
                              java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
        this method starts the appium server depending on your OS.
        Parameters:
        os - your machine OS (windows/linux/mac)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred
        org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException - An exception indicating that the executing a subprocesses failed
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.

      • stopAppiumServer

        public void stopAppiumServer(java.lang.String os)
                      throws org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException,
                             java.io.IOException
        this method stops the appium server.
        Parameters:
        os - your machine OS (windows/linux/mac).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
        org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteException - An exception indicating that the executing a subprocesses failed.

      • propertiesFileLoad

        public void propertiesFileLoad(java.lang.String platform)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        this method loads properties files config and file having test data.
        Parameters:
        platform - android or ios, to load specific test data file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - property files are not loaded successfully
